header.gameNote: MEAC Men's Tournament - 1st Round RALEIGH NC

article.headline: S. Carolina St. 78, Bethune-Cookman 69
article.story: RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) -- Jason Flagler scored 23 points, and South Carolina State rallied in the second half to take a 78-69 victory over Bethune-Cookman in the first round of the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference tournament Tuesday night. The eighth-seeded Bulldogs (13-19) will take on the tournament's top seed, Morgan State (20-9), in the quarterfinals Wednessday night. Jesse Burton scored 15 points for the Bulldogs, including 4-of-6 from 3-point range. Reserve Julius Carter scored 13 points and grabbed nine rebounds, while Everett Spencer added 12 for S.C. State. After trailing 30-25 at halftime, South Carolina State shot 18-of-30 for 60 percent in the final 20 minutes. Bethune-Cookman (11-21) had to depend on its starting five to carry most of the load as the team had only three substitutes due to injuries. The ninth-seeded Wildcats did a good job in shutting down forward Jason Johnson, a second-team All-MEAC center, holding him to just seven points. All-Freshman guard Carrio Bennett was held scoreless. Dewayne Pettus and John Holmes led Bethune-Cookman with 17 points apiece. Dominique Whatley added 16 points as the Wildcats forced South Carolina State into 10 first-half turnovers and outscored the taller Bulldogs 18-8 in the paint and 42-32 overall.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
